sections.summary: The 'Smart' Envelope. Keltner Channels place bands above and below a central Exponential Moving Average (EMA) based on volatility (ATR). Unlike Bollinger Bands, they don't spasm with every price twitch. They are smoother and trend-friendlier.
sections.deep_dive: Composed of a 20-day EMA and bands set at 2x ATR. Because they use Average True Range (ATR) rather than Standard Deviation, they filter out noise more effectively. A close outside the channel is a significant breakout signal.
sections.council_debate: {"geopolitics": "Supply chain shocks are permanent shifts, not noise. Keltner Channels filter out the daily noise better than Bollinger Bands. When price breaks the upper Keltner channel during a crisis, it means the 'Risk Premium' has structurally reset higher.", "macro": "Inflation is a trend, not a mean-reverting oscillator. Keltner Channels are superior for trend-following inflation assets (Gold, Oil). Ride the upper band as long as the macro narrative holds.", "quant": "We test 'Squeeze' strategies. When Bollinger Bands contract *inside* Keltner Channels, it signals extreme compression. This 'TTM Squeeze' setup is one of the highest probability trade setups in history.", "technical": "The 'Slingshot'. When price pulls back to the EMA (Mean) in a strong uptrend, it often bounces exactly off the 20 EMA or the lower Keltner Band. This is the low-risk entry point.", "policy": "Central Banks hate volatility. They try to keep rates inside the Keltner Channels. When rates break the upper channel, the Bond Vigilantes have taken control from the Fed.", "tech": "Crypto is too volatile for standard setups. We use 3x ATR for Keltner Channels in Bitcoin. A breakout of the 3x ATR band is a 'God Candle' event."}
sections.forecast_risks: The 'Flat Market Grind'. In a sideways market, price will grind along the bands without trending, triggering false breakout signals. You MUST use ADX to confirm trend strength before trusting a Keltner breakout.
sections.gms_conclusion: Smoother than Bollinger. Better for Trends. The standard for professionals who want to filter out the noise.
